suncertify.server.impl
Class RemoteDBAccessFactoryImpl

java.lang.Object
  suncertify.commons.LoggingObject
      suncertify.server.impl.RemoteDBAccessFactoryImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
Remote, RemoteDBAccessFactory, UnrefencedListener<RemoteData>
public class RemoteDBAccessFactoryImpl
extends LoggingObject
implements RemoteDBAccessFactory, UnrefencedListener<RemoteData>

Remote RMI Factory implementation: Instances of this class are bound to the RMI registry and used remotely to obtain references to other remote objects created on demand.
This class is used to create instances of RemoteDBAccess.

The main purpose of using a RMI factory, creating RemoteDBAccess instances on demand (usually one per client) instead of publishing a single instance of RemoteDBAccess in the registry and share it among all clients is to know when a client session terminates and so being able to release resources allocated by the client.

A factory object keeps track of all active instances created by it, those instances are referred later in the documentation as managed instances.

Version:
1.0 30/09/2010
Author:
Ignacio del Valle Alles
See Also:
Applying the Factory Pattern to JavaTM RMI

Constructor Detail

RemoteDBAccessFactoryImpl

public RemoteDBAccessFactoryImpl(DBAccess dbAccess,
                                 int port)
Creates a new factory from the specified arguments.

Parameters:
dbAccess - Database access instance that will be used by all the newly created managed instances.
port - Port where the newly created RemoteDBAccess instances will be exported (making them available to receive remote calls).
Method Detail

createRemoteDBAccess

public RemoteDBAccess createRemoteDBAccess()
                                    throws RemoteException
Creates and returns a new instance of RemoteData, exporting it to the RMI runtime in the port specified at constructor.

Specified by:
createRemoteDBAccess in interface RemoteDBAccessFactory
Returns:
the newly created instance.
Throws:
RemoteException - if an communication-related error occurs.

rejectIncomingCalls

public void rejectIncomingCalls()
Sets factory to reject incoming calls. All managed instances that has been created by the factory are set to make the rejection.

interruptPendingThreads

public void interruptPendingThreads()
Makes all managed instances to interrupt all their threads currently executing.

notifyUnreference

public void notifyUnreference(RemoteData remoteData)
Managed instances call this method to communicate its unreferenced state. When a managed instance is unreferenced (has lost its client reference), it is no longer needed and the factory discards it.

Specified by:
notifyUnreference in interface UnrefencedListener<RemoteData>
Parameters:
remoteData - the unreferenced object.
See Also:
UnrefencedListener.notifyUnreference(java.rmi.server.Unreferenced)
